md:
giải nghĩa từ "wheel" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan.

1. Wheel (noun) - bánh xe
	* Meaning: A circular object that rotates around a central point, used to move or support something.
	* Example: The car has four wheels.
	* Related words: tire, rim, axle, hub

2. Wheel (verb) - quay bánh xe
	* Meaning: To turn or rotate something, especially a wheel, around a central point.
	* Example: She wheeled her bicycle into the garage.
	* Related words: spin, turn, rotate, revolve

3. Wheel (idiom) - quay vòng
	* Meaning: To change direction or move in a circular motion.
	* Example: The car wheeled around the corner and sped away.
	* Related words: turn around, spin around, circle around

4. Wheel (idiom) - quay trở lại
	* Meaning: To return to a previous place or situation.
	* Example: After traveling around the world, she wheeled back to her hometown.
	* Related words: come back, return, go back, revert

5. Wheel (idiom) - quay lại
	* Meaning: To repeat or do something again.
	* Example: The company wheeled out their old marketing strategy to promote the new product.
	* Related words: bring back, revive, repeat, reiterate
html:
giải nghĩa từ "wheel" sang tiếng việt; đưa ra nghĩa tiếng việt theo từ loại và đưa ra câu ví dụ, các từ liên quan.

  1. Wheel (noun) - bánh xe

    • Meaning: A circular object that rotates around a central point, used to move or support something.
    • Example: The car has four wheels.
    • Related words: tire, rim, axle, hub

  2. Wheel (verb) - quay bánh xe

    • Meaning: To turn or rotate something, especially a wheel, around a central point.
    • Example: She wheeled her bicycle into the garage.
    • Related words: spin, turn, rotate, revolve

  3. Wheel (idiom) - quay vòng

    • Meaning: To change direction or move in a circular motion.
    • Example: The car wheeled around the corner and sped away.
    • Related words: turn around, spin around, circle around

  4. Wheel (idiom) - quay trở lại

    • Meaning: To return to a previous place or situation.
    • Example: After traveling around the world, she wheeled back to her hometown.
    • Related words: come back, return, go back, revert

  5. Wheel (idiom) - quay lại

    • Meaning: To repeat or do something again.
    • Example: The company wheeled out their old marketing strategy to promote the new product.
    • Related words: bring back, revive, repeat, reiterate
